Our paper is accepted at NDSS 2025!
item.description:
GadgetMeter: Quantitatively and Accurately Gauge the Exploitability of Speculative Gadgets

Our paper will be presented during NDSS 2025 (Feb. 24th - Feb. 28th).

For more details, please see the NDSS 2025 program: https://www.ndss-symposium.org/ndss2025/program/.

Author List:

  • Qi Ling (Shanghai Jia Tong University)
  • Yujun Liang (Tsinghua University)
  • Yi Ren (Tsinghua University)
  • Baris Kasikci (University of Washington)
  • Shuwen Deng* (Tsinghua University)

[*]: corresponding author.

[1] Qi Ling, Yujun Liang, Yi Ren, Baris Kasikci and Shuwen Deng. NDSS 2025. GadgetMeter: Quantitatively and Accurately Gauge the Exploitability of Speculative Gadgets. In Proceedings of the 2025 Network and Distributed System Security (NDSS’ 25) Symposium, February 24–28, 2025, San Diego, CA, USA.

item.title: Hecaton: Training Large Language Models with Scalable Chiplet Systems
Our paper is accepted at CCS 2024!
item.description:
CiMSAT: Exploiting SAT Analysis to Attack Compute-in-Memory Architecture Defenses

Our paper will be presented on Thursday, October 17th, at Main Conference, 11:45 AM – 12:00 PM, Grand Ballroom Salon E.

Welcome to the 7-3. HW & CPS: Security of Circuit Design and FPGAs session.

For more details, please see the ACM CCS 2024 program: https://www.sigsac.org/ccs/CCS2024/program/schedule.html.

Author List:

  • Jianfeng Wang (Tsinghua University)
  • Huazhong Yang (Tsinghua University)
  • Shuwen Deng* (Tsinghua University)
  • Xueqing Li* (Tsinghua University)

[*]: corresponding author.

[1] Jianfeng Wang, Huazhong Yang, Shuwen Deng, and Xueqing Li. 2024. CiMSAT: Exploiting SAT Analysis to Attack Compute-in-Memory Architecture Defenses. In Proceedings of the 2024 ACM SIGSAC Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS’ 24), October 14–18, 2024, Salt Lake City, UT, USA.
